page.title: 18BRIDGE OF EARN HOSPITAL
page.content: The hospital was built in 1940 as a temporary measure in pre_fabricated huts for war casulties. The site which covers 50 acres had good clean air and was unlikely to be bombed. It became and has remained a main centre for physiotherapy and a major employer for 45 years, but is due for closure in 1990. It has 250 beds and deals with 58000 inpatients and 40000 outpatients per year. It has 240 medical staff and 75 administration and maintenance, mainly local or from Fife and Perth. Visiting hours are from 2_8.30pm every day and there are facilities for parents staying with their sick children. The catering is done on the premises with a choice of menu and special diets.
